English Content: I bow to the magnificent Purna Purushottam Narayan Sahajanand Swami. I bow to the form of Akshardham, Aksharbrahma Gunatitanand Swami, who is the endower of ultimate knowledge. I bow with love to Pragji Bhakta who is devoid of sin and is brahmaswarup. I continuously bow with devotion to Shastriji Maharaj, Yogiji Maharaj, Pramukh Swami Maharaj and Mahant Swami Maharaj , who are full of all virtues, for my liberation.
Gujurati Content:
વન્દે શ્રીપુરુષોત્તમં ચ પરમં ધામાક્ષરં જ્ઞાનદં
વન્દે પ્રાગજીભક્ત મેવ-મનઘં બ્રહ્મસ્વરૂપં મુદા ।
વન્દે યજ્ઞપુરુષદાસચરણં શ્રીયોગિરાજં તથા
વન્દે શ્રીપ્રમુખં મહંતગુણિનં મોક્ષાય ભક્ત્યા સદા ॥
Transliteration Content:
Vande Shrī Puruṣhottamam cha paramam dhāmākṣharam gnānadam
Vande Prāgajī Bhakta-meva-managham brahmaswarūpam mudā |
Vande Yagnapuruṣhdās charaṇam Shrī Yogīrājam tathā
Vande Shrī Pramukham Mahanta-guṇinam mokṣhāya bhaktyā sadā ||

English Content: One who is adorned with eternal virtues; who is all-pervasive; whose form is divine; who endows jivas, ishwars, and infinite muktas with bliss; who is the cause of all avatars; whose renown is sung in the Vedas; and who is worthy of knowing by even the great Munis; that Sahajand, along with Akshar, I bow to eternally. (Brahmaswarup Shastriji Maharaj)
Gujurati Content:
શ્રીમત્‍સદ્‍ગુણ-શાલિનં ચિદચિદિ વ્યાપ્તં ચ દિવ્યાકૃતિં
જીવેશાક્ષર મુક્તકોટિ સુખદં નૈકાવતારાધિપમ્ ।
જ્ઞેયં શ્રીપુરુષોત્તમં મુનિવરૈ ર્વેદાદિકીર્ત્યં વિભું
તમ્મૂલાક્ષર-યુક્તમેવ સહજાનંદં ચ વન્દે સદા ॥
Transliteration Content:
Shrīmat-‍sad‍guṇa shālinam chidachidi vyāptam cha divyākṛutim
Jīveshākṣhara mukta-koṭi sukhadam naikāvatārādhipam ।
Gneyam Shrī Puruṣhottamam munivarair-vedādikīrtyam vibhūm
Tammūlākṣhara-yuktameva Sahajānandam cha vande sadā ॥

English Content: May God protect us together. Let us learn together and work together. Let us progress together and may we become enlightened together. May we never quarrel with each other. (Taittiriya Upanishad)
Gujurati Content:
ૐ સહનાવવતુ સહ નૌ ભુનક્તુ સહ વીર્યં કરવાવહૈ ।
તેજસ્વિનાવધીતમસ્તુ મા વિદ્વિષાવહૈ ।  
ૐ શાન્તિઃ શાન્તિઃ શાન્તિઃ ।
Transliteration Content:
Aum sahanāvavatu saha nau bhunaktu saha vīryam karavāvahai |
Tejasvīnā-vadhītamastu mā vid-viṣhāvahai |
Aum shāntihi shāntihi shāntihi |

English Content: Gunatitanand Swami is Mul Aksharbrahma. Shriji Maharaj is Bhagwan Purushottam. Whoever understands this principle will be freed from the cycles of births and deaths.
Gujurati Content:
ગુણાતીતોક્ષરં બ્રહ્મ ભગવાન્ પુરુષોત્તમઃ ।
જનો જાનન્નિદં સત્યં મુચ્યતે ભવ-બંધનાત્ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Guṇātītokṣharam Brahma Bhagawāna Puruṣhottamaha |
Jano jānan-nidam satyam muchyate bhava-bandhanāt ||

English Content: The Guru who shows the path to eradicating the world’s miseries is Brahmā, is Vishnu, and is Mahādev. The one who gives true knowledge is the manifest form of Parabrahma. (Shree Guru Gita)
Gujurati Content:
ગુરુ ર્બ્રહ્મા ગુરુર્વિષ્ણુ, ર્ગુરુ ર્દેવો મહેશ્વરઃ ।
ગુરુઃ સાક્ષાત્ પરં બ્રહ્મ, તસ્મૈ શ્રીગુરવે નમઃ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Gurur-brahmā gurur-viṣhṇur gurur-devo maheshvaraha ।
Guruhu sākṣhāt param brahma, tasmai shrīgurave namaha ॥

English Content: You only are (my) mother, you are my father, you are my kin, you are my friend, you are my knowledge, and you are my wealth. You are the God of all deities and you are everything to me.
Gujurati Content:
ત્વમેવ માતા ચ પિતા ત્વમેવ
ત્વમેવ બંધુશ્ચ સખા ત્વમેવ ।
ત્વમેવ વિદ્યા દ્રવિણં ત્વમેવ
ત્વમેવ સર્વં મમ દેવ દેવ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Tvameva mātā cha pitā tvameva
Tvameva bandhushcha sakhā tvameva |
Tvameva vidyā draviṇam tvameva
Tvameva sarvam mama deva deva ||

English Content: May all be happy on this earth. May all be healthy. May all see good in everything. May no one be unhappy.
Gujurati Content:
સર્વેત્ર સુખિનઃ સન્તુ સર્વે સન્તુ નિરામયાઃ ।
સર્વે ભદ્રાણિ પશ્યન્તુ મા કશ્ચિદ્‍ દુઃખમાપ્નુયાત્ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Sarvetra sukhinaha santu, sarve santu nirāmayāh |
Sarve bhadrāni pashyantu, mā kashchid dukhamāpnuyāt ||

English Content: A person who is not educated; who is not ready to work hard; who does not donate whatever he has; who does not have knowledge; who does not have a good character or good qualities; and one who does not obey dharma, such a person on this earth is just a useless person, he is as good as any other animal.
Gujurati Content:
યેષાં ન વિદ્યા ન તપો ન દાનં
જ્ઞાનં ન શીલં ન ગુણો ન ધર્મ: ।
તે મૃત્યુલોકે ભુવિ ભારભૂતા
મનુષ્યરૂપેણ મૃગાશ્ચરન્તિ ।।
Transliteration Content:
Yeshām na vidyā na tapo na dānam, 
gnānam na sheelam na guṇo na dharmah |
Te mrutyu-loke bhuvi bhārabhutā, 
manushya-roopeṇa mrugāshcharanti ||

English Content: One with full faith, who is attentively focused, who has conquered the senses, and has achieved transcendental knowledge quickly attains supreme peace. (Bhagavad Gita, Vachanamrut Gadhada II-16)
Gujurati Content:
શ્રદ્ધાવાન્ લભતે જ્ઞાનં તત્પરઃ સંયતેન્દ્રિયઃ ।
જ્ઞાનં લબ્ધ્વા પરાં શાન્તિમચિરેણાધિગચ્છતિ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Shraddhāvān-labhate gnānam, tatparaha sanyatendriyaha |
Gnānam labdhvā parām shāntim,-achireṇādhigachhati ||

English Content: Abandon all varieties of dharma and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear. (Bhagavad Gita, Vachanamrut Gadhada II-17)
Gujurati Content:
સર્વધર્માન્ પરિત્યજ્ય મામેકં શરણં વ્રજ ।
અહં ત્વાં સર્વપાપેભ્યો મોક્ષયિષ્યામિ મા શુચઃ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Sarvadharmān parityajya māmekam sharaṇam vraja |
Aham tvām sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā shuchah ||

English Content: Hearing and chanting about the holy name of God, remembering them, serving the lotus feet of the God, offering God respectful worship with sixteen types of paraphernalia, offering prayers to God, becoming His servant, considering God one's best friend, and surrendering everything unto Him (in other words, serving Him with the body, mind and words) -- these nine processes are accepted as pure devotional service. (Shrimad Bhāgwat, Vachanamrut Gadhada I-40)
Gujurati Content:
શ્રવણં કીર્તનં વિષ્ણોઃ સ્મરણં પાદસેવનમ્ ।
અર્ચનં વંદનં દાસ્યં સખ્યમ્ આત્મનિવેદનમ્ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Shravaṇam kīrtanam Viṣhṇoho smaraṇam pād-sevanam |
Archanam vandanam dāsyam sakhyam-ātmanivedanam ||

English Content: One who realizes himself to be Brahman becomes full of joy. He never laments or desires to have anything. He is equally disposed toward every living entity. In that state he attains pure devotional service unto Me. (Bhagavad Gita, Vachanamrut Panchala 2)
Gujurati Content:
બ્રહ્મભૂતઃ પ્રસન્નાત્મા ન શોચતિ ન કાંક્ષતિ ।
સમઃ સર્વેષુ ભૂતેષુ મદ્‍ભક્તિં લભતે પરામ્ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Brahma-Bhootaha Prasannātmā / Na Shochati Na Kānkshati |
Samaha Sarveshu Bhuteshu / Madbhaktim Labhate Parām ||

English Content: After repeatedly reflecting on all the scriptures, I have arrived at one principal conclusion; that life's goal is to attain Bhagwan Narayan. (Ling Puran, Swamini Vato 1/35)
Gujurati Content:
આલોડ્ય સર્વશાસ્ત્રાણિ વિચાર્ય ચ પુનઃ પુનઃ ।
ઇદમેકં સુનિષ્પન્નં ધ્યેયો નારાયણો હરિઃ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Āloḍya sarva shāstrāṇi, vichārya cha punah punah |
Idam-ekam sunishpannam, dhyeyo nārāyaṇo harihi ||

English Content: ‘If a person maintains profound love towards the Ekāntik Sant of God just as resolutely as he maintains profound love towards his own relatives, then the gateway to liberation opens for him.’ (Shrimad Bhāgwat, Vachanamrut Gadhada I-54)
Gujurati Content:
પ્રસંગમજરં પાશમ્ આત્મનઃ કવયો વિદુઃ ।
સ એવ સાધુષુ કૃતો મોક્ષદ્વારમપાવૃતમ્ ॥
Transliteration Content:
Prasanga-majaram pāsham-ātmanah kavayo viduhu |
Sa eva sādhuṣhu kṛuto mokṣha-dwārama-pāvṛutam ||

English Content: From the grace bestowed by a Sadhu, happiness arises, your work gets completed, and you attain the abode of Purushottam (Akshardham). (Bhaktachintamani 2/2)
Gujurati Content:
સંત કૃપાએ સુખ ઊપજે, સંત કૃપાથી સરે કામ,
સંત કૃપાથી પામીએ, પૂરણ પુરુષોત્તમ ધામ ।
Transliteration Content:
Santa krupāe sukha upaje, Santa krupāthi sare kāma,
Santa krupāthi pāmiye, puraṇa purushottama dhāma

English Content: From the grace bestowed by a Sadhu, true intellect is awakened, true virtues are gained. Without that grace no one has attained virtuous qualities. (Bhaktachintamani 2/3)
Gujurati Content:
સંત કૃપાએ સદ્‌મતિ જાગે, સંત કૃપાથી સદ્‌ગુણ,
સંત કૃપા વિના સાધુતા, કહોને પામ્યા કુણ ।
Transliteration Content:
Santa krupāe sadamati jāge, Santa krupāthi sadagunṇ,
Santa krupā vinā sādhutā, kahone pāmyā kuṇa

English Content: I thought in my head, out of the wish fulfilling cow, the wish fulfilling tree, the philosopher's stone, and the wish fulfilling stone - none are equal to the Sant. (Bhaktachintamani 2/7)
Gujurati Content:
કામદુઘા કલ્પતરુ, પારસ ચિંતામણિ ચાર,
સંત સમાન એકે નહિ, મેં મનમાં કર્યો વિચાર ।
Transliteration Content:
Kāma-dughā kalpataru, pārasa chintāmaṇi chāra,
Santa samāna eke nahi, me manamā karyo vichāra

English Content: Very little happiness lies in worldly pleasures - it comes and goes. The happiness from serving a true Sant is firm and eternal. (Bhaktachintamani 2/8)
Gujurati Content:
અલ્પ સુખ એમાં રહ્યું, મળી ટળી જાય છે એહ,
સંત સેવ્યે સુખ ઉપજે, રહે અખંડ અટળ એહ ।
Transliteration Content:
Alpa sukha emā rahyu, maḷi taḷi jāya chhe eha,
Santa sevye sukha upaje, rahe akhanḍa ataḷa eha

English Content: Those who remain in Satsang by being a servant of a servant, I will consider their devotion fruitful and bask in it. (Bhaktachintamani 68/10)
Gujurati Content:
દાસના દાસ થઈને, વળી જે રહે સતસંગમાં,
ભક્તિ તેની ભલી માનીશ, રાચીશ તેના રંગમાં |
Transliteration Content:
Dās-nā dās thaine, vali je rahe satsang-mā,
Bhakti teni bhali mānish, rāchish tenā rangmā

English Content: Believe this one thing that I tell you, you are the atma, not the body, believe yourself to be the atma (which is divine and full of bliss), seperate from the body which is full of misery. (Bhaktachintamani 71/37)
Gujurati Content:
એક વાત કહું માનો તેહ, આપણે આતમા નહિ દેહ
માનો ચૈતન્યરૂપ તમારું, દુઃખરૂપ દેહ તેહ ન્યારું |
Transliteration Content:
Eka vāta kahu māno teha, āpaṇe ātmā nahi deha,
Māno chaitanyaroopa tamāru, dukharoopa deha teha nyaaru
